page.title: 04Stapleford,Wishford.History.
page.content: {Stapleford}(a ford marked by a staple or post). The remains of a Norman castle can be found in the village,only the outline of the moat can be seen. {Wishford}(the ford by the wyche elm). Breadstones are set in the churchyard wall and record the price of bread from 1800 to 1984.Ebsbury Hill is the site of an Iron Age fort,crescent shaped and a mile in extent. There are many interesting things in the parish churches,both have Norman fonts.St.Giles'Church contains one of the oldest fire engines in the country.There are also two fine tombs, the tomb of Sir Richard Grobham,one of Wiltshire's finest monuments,early 17th century,and the tomb of Sir Thomas Bonham,dated by experts at around 1350.Also there are the fine carved Royal Arms of Queen Anne.
